status_definitions.SECURE: Statutory set-aside or permanent authorization; minimal annual risk
status_definitions.STABLE: Funded and active; subject to normal appropriations process
status_definitions.STABLE_BUT_VULNERABLE: Active but exposed to executive/legislative restructuring
status_definitions.AT_RISK: Facing specific threat; advocacy action required
status_definitions.UNCERTAIN: Structural ambiguity; agency reorganization or unclear reauth path
status_definitions.FLAGGED: Terminated, zeroed out, or requires specialist intervention

positions.reasoning: FY26 funded at $34.291M. Core vehicle for Tribal climate adaptation. Non-competitive direct-access pathway.

extensible_fields.tightened_language: Protect the $34.291M base funding line as a floor, ensuring non-competitive, direct-access pathways for Tribes to bypass administrative bottlenecks inherent in discretionary grant cycles.

positions.reasoning: Established BIA program tied to TCR appropriations line. Stable under current Interior budget.
FEMA announced termination of BRIC on April 4, 2025. FY24/25 cycles canceled. ~$882M unobligated IIJA funds returned to Treasury or reapportioned.

extensible_fields.specialist_focus: Advocacy must pivot to the replacement mechanism. Ensure Tribal set-asides are baked into the new 'responsive mitigation approach' from day one.
extensible_fields.strength_area: Fully obligated projects (started construction) are still being honored; protect these existing obligations.

positions.reasoning: Final regulations (Jan 2026) confirm Tribal instrumentalities, but IRA ยง6417 faces active reconciliation repeal threat. Bipartisan defense coalition needed.

extensible_fields.threat_vector: Budget reconciliation repeal of IRA provisions
extensible_fields.tightened_language: Maintain the January 2026 final rule status of Tribal instrumentalities (Section 17/Section 3 corps) to ensure liquidity for Tribal energy projects without the need for tax-equity partners.

positions.reasoning: IIJA-funded supplemental lines (Lead/PFAS) remain active through FY26. Baseline program under CWA/SDWA is permanent.
Established program under Indian Environmental GAP Act of 1992. Annual appropriations; stable baseline.
Permanent authorization under Clean Air Act ยง105. Stable baseline appropriations.
Loss of BRIC as primary funding incentive reduces plan ROI; statutory requirement remains but funding for planning is opaque.

extensible_fields.proposed_fix: Legislative mandate for automatic plan updates post-disaster.

positions.reasoning: Tribal set-aside (2%) is statutorily protected under IIJA ยง11405. Not subject to annual appropriations volatility.
High Tribal participation but subject to Forest Management reforms (EO 14225). IIJA funding expires when exhausted.

extensible_fields.proposed_fix: Codify Tribal match waivers in FY26 Interior Approps.

positions.reasoning: Active program but DOE reorganization and IRA implementation uncertainty create structural ambiguity.
Established formula program under NAHASDA. Reauthorization pending but baseline funding stable.
NOAA climate programs face potential restructuring. Tribal-specific lines not well-protected in appropriations.
Formula-based under 23 U.S.C. 202. Stable statutory authorization.
IIJA supplemental funding expires FY26. Baseline reauthorization path unclear.
Technical assistance program tied to WaterSMART. Stable but dependent on parent program reauthorization.
